content.description: Fun lead/climb that starts left of Mesiah. Crack looks like a lightning bolt that goes up and left above a slab that is off limits.  Anticlimatic end inside a chimney with a large, blocky chockstone in it. A more exciting finish is to protect in the chimney and head right for a no-pro to the top. (The old original book says this route follows the crack for a bit then goes straight up. I dont remember it there is any protection for this version...)
content.protection: passive pro! A set of nuts and maybe a hex or two if youre leading and chord for the top anchors of trees
content.location: left of Mesiah set several feet above a left running slab

content.description: Overhanging face to the right of medusa
content.protection: Could be led with nuts and small cams.

content.description: Stay between and use two small broken cracks on an obvious face. The crux is about halfway up the route. You will gain a ledge to your left on what looks like a square bulge. Hit this with your hands but don't be tricked...you want to head right for some good hands, then straight up.
content.protection: Lots of trees at the top to set a solid anchor. Possible to trad lead.
content.location: Look to climbers left of the obvious arete (Medusa - 5.10).  Climb obvious face.

content.description: Start on arete corner with decent sidepulls on right, pull the roof and continue up easier terrian on the face.
content.location: just right of mesiah and left of a vegetated dihedral

content.description: Dihedral and off width crack.  Bad rock near top grinds when stood on, but is stable.  Requires a variety of techniques, good route for noobs to learn on.  Reaches are long for small children, though.
content.protection: 0.5 cam or large nut and one loop in rock tunnel.  Bomber tree and rock at top for top belay.  Will get 8 feet above pro at one point.
content.location: Large crack on far left of Tower of the Gods.   Easy walk off top or top belay.

content.description: Climb the dihedral just a few feet right of Thor.
Just upstream from South Wall, this area is in the trees/shade and is relatively unvisited.  All things considered, this is a good place to visit with easy TR setups.
